unnormalised: **Massive Fire Breaks Out in Sector 17, Noida; Rescue Operations Underway**
normalised: Massive Fire Breaks Out in Sector seventeen, Noida; Rescue Operations Underway

unnormalised: Noida, UP – A major fire erupted earlier today at a residential building located at Flat No. 204, Tower A, Gulmohar Apartments, Sector 17, Noida, 201301. The incident was reported at approximately 11:30 AM, sending plumes of smoke billowing into the sky, visible from several kilometers away. Initial reports suggest a short circuit may have triggered the blaze.
normalised: Noida, U-P – A major fire erupted earlier today at a residential building located at Flat Number two hundred and four, Tower A, Gulmohar Apartments, Sector seventeen, Noida, two zero one three zero one. The incident was reported at approximately eleven thirty A-M, sending plumes of smoke billowing into the sky, visible from several kilometer away. Initial reports suggest a short circuit may have triggered the blaze.

unnormalised: Firefighters from multiple stations, including those from Sector 6 and Phase II, were immediately dispatched to the scene. As of 3:00 PM, the fire is still raging, though authorities claim they have contained the fire and are working to completely extinguish the flames. Residents from neighboring apartments were swiftly evacuated as a precautionary measure.
normalised: Firefighters from multiple stations, including those from Sector six and Phase two, were immediately dispatched to the scene. As of three zero zero P-M, the fire is still raging, though authorities claim they have contained the fire and are working to completely extinguish the flames. Residents from neighboring apartments were swiftly evacuated as a precautionary measure.

unnormalised: "The situation is under control, but challenging," said Fire Officer Rajesh Kumar. "We are doing our best to ensure everyone's safety and prevent further damage to other properties." The intensity of the fire has made rescue operations difficult, but firefighters are using ladders and breathing apparatuses to reach residents trapped on upper floors.
normalised: "The situation is under control, but challenging," said Fire Officer Rajesh Kumar. "We are doing our best to ensure everyone's safety and prevent further damage to other properties." The intensity of the fire has made rescue operations difficult, but firefighters are using ladders and breathing apparatuses to reach residents trapped on upper floors.

unnormalised: Eyewitness accounts paint a harrowing picture. "I saw flames coming out of the windows of Flat 204. It was terrifying," said Sunita Sharma, a resident of Flat No. 205, Tower A. "Thankfully, the authorities were quick to respond." Many residents have gathered outside the building, anxiously awaiting news of their loved ones.
normalised: Eyewitness accounts paint a harrowing picture. "I saw flames coming out of the windows of Flat two hundred and four. It was terrifying," said Sunita Sharma, a resident of Flat Number two hundred and five, Tower A. "Thankfully, the authorities were quick to respond." Many residents have gathered outside the building, anxiously awaiting news of their loved ones.

unnormalised: As of now, details regarding casualties are still emerging. Preliminary reports suggest that at least 3 people have suffered minor injuries due to smoke inhalation and have been rushed to Kailash Hospital, H-33, Sector 27, Noida, 201301. The police are investigating the cause of the fire, and a thorough assessment of the damage will be conducted once the fire is completely extinguished.
normalised: As of now, details regarding casualties are still emerging. Preliminary reports suggest that at least three people have suffered minor injuries due to smoke inhalation and have been rushed to Kailash Hospital, H-thirty three, Sector twenty seven, Noida, two zero one three zero one. The police are investigating the cause of the fire, and a thorough assessment of the damage will be conducted once the fire is completely extinguished.

unnormalised: The District Magistrate has announced an immediate compensation of Rs. 50,000 for families who have suffered losses due to the fire. A temporary relief camp has been set up at the community center in Sector 15, Noida, for those who have been displaced. Residents are urged to remain calm and cooperate with authorities as the rescue and investigation efforts continue.
normalised: The District Magistrate has announced an immediate compensation of rupee fifty thousand for families who have suffered losses due to the fire. A temporary relief camp has been set up at the community center in Sector fifteen, Noida, for those who have been displaced. Residents are urged to remain calm and cooperate with authorities as the rescue and investigation efforts continue.

unnormalised: Further updates will be provided as they become available. Helpline numbers have been established for families seeking information: 0120-2515151 and 0120-2515152. Remember to stay safe and be aware of your surroundings.
normalised: Further updates will be provided as they become available. Helpline numbers have been established for families seeking information: zero one two zero-two five one five one five one and zero one two zero-two five one five one five two. Remember to stay safe and be aware of your surroundings.
